episodeList.title: BOSAI: Science that Can Save Your Life

episode.description: Japan has a long history of natural disasters. BOSAI explores how to overcome them and save lives with the power of science. In this first episode, we'll look at the latest in tsunami research.
episode.subtitle: #1 TSUNAMI
episode.title: BOSAI: Science that Can Save Your Life

episode.description: Many Japan cities sit in low-lying areas, putting them at risk of floods. This program looks at the unique mechanisms of urban flooding such as sewage backflow, and explores ways to save lives.
episode.subtitle: #2 URBAN FLOODING
episode.title: BOSAI: Science that Can Save Your Life

episode.description: When Typhoon Jebi struck Osaka in 2018, strong gusts caused destruction of buildings in unforeseeable ways. We'll look at how urban structures may have intensified the storm's wind.
episode.subtitle: #3 URBAN WINDSTORMS
episode.title: BOSAI: Science that Can Save Your Life

episode.description: This program examines two types of earthquake phenomena: long-period ground motion and the long-period pulse. We'll also look at the effects of earthquakes on buildings and explore ways to save lives.
episode.subtitle: #4 Long-period Ground Motion and A New Threat
episode.title: BOSAI: Science that Can Save Your Life
